title: Do Silicon Valley tech companies really deserve such a large share of intelligent people? - Quora

response.answer_text: Do they have such a large share of intelligent people? Are you sure? Although it may seem like it, you have to compare it to every single field and location. If you think about it, what about so many different companies in places like Shenzhen and Taiwan, who have created so many things. Think about farmers in the middle of nowhere who learnt how to hack their own tractors. In reality, although it may seem like it, you have to remember that many people are insanely intelligent yet just choose to do something else other than work for a tech company.

Deserve? That's a concerning way of looking at it. People deserve the freedom to decide for themselves what they do with their lives. Silicon Valley has a disproportionate share of SOME types of talent because it rewards that talent (and it's a relatively nice place to live). The companies earn the talent.

“Who’s more deserving” is a very interesting moral idea, that’s apparently common across all cultures. And recent research has even shown that certain moral values, like judging ‘fairness’, are already hardwired in humans from birth. That said, in the “Free Market”, the Laws of Supply and Demand are what decide, not ‘fairness’.
